caseStudy.collaborationContent: Worked in close partnership with the VP of Engineering, who sponsored the initiative as a critical business enabler. The project was self-initiated, proposed, and initially implemented solo before being transitioned to a dedicated team for long-term ownership.
caseStudy.contextContent: Joined shortly after Series B ($30M), as the company prepared to onboard its first major enterprise customer. Engineering org (~10–15 engineers) had iterated rapidly to reach product-market fit, leaving the core audio-to-notes pipeline fragile, opaque, and increasingly risky to scale.
caseStudy.outcomesArchitecture: Architecture scaled with company growth and became the foundation for subsequent pipeline work.
caseStudy.outcomesCustomerMigration: Successfully migrated the first enterprise customer to the new pipeline within ~7 months; completed full customer migration incrementally over the next ~2 months to minimize risk.
caseStudy.outcomesMonitoring: Enabled the ability to build monitoring and alarms against telemetry to reduce reaction times to production issues.
caseStudy.outcomesPipelineThroughput: The pipeline now processes over 100 hours of audio per minute. It has met the needs of the business through significant growth in customer base and usage volume.
caseStudy.outcomesReliability: Achieved a step-change improvement in system reliability, debuggability, and operational visibility; for the first time, engineers could inspect live workflow state, diagnose failures deterministically, and recover safely.
caseStudy.outcomesTemplates: Established reusable project templates (CI/CD, Helm charts, service layout) that were adopted across the engineering organization.
caseStudy.outcomesTemporalAdoption: Temporal became a standard platform primitive reused well beyond the original pipeline project.
caseStudy.roleScopeContent: Acted as a horizontal senior technical leader, taking ownership of cross-cutting systems with no natural product owner. Led end-to-end redesign of the core audio-to-notes processing pipeline used by multiple product verticals; served as primary technical decision-maker and on-call escalation point until ownership transitioned to a dedicated team.
caseStudy.title: Impact Case Study – Abridge

caseStudyContributions.apiBoundary: Enforced a single standardized API boundary for all pipeline entry points, eliminating divergent implementations and making system behavior observable and predictable.
caseStudyContributions.leadership: Defined and owned architecture, technical product design, and implementation of the new pipeline from the ground up.
caseStudyContributions.loadTests: Built and ran load tests to validate scaling behavior prior to broad customer migration.
caseStudyContributions.reverseEngineering: Reverse-engineered implicit system behavior from legacy code to establish explicit baseline requirements, then defined forward-looking requirements under uncertain scale and evolving product needs.
caseStudyContributions.templates: Designed reusable infrastructure and project templates (CI/CD, Helm charts, service scaffolding) that later became the foundation for other engineering efforts.
caseStudyContributions.testingLintingDocs: Introduced end-to-end testing, strict linting standards, structured documentation, flow diagrams where none previously existed.
caseStudyContributions.title: Contributions
caseStudyContributions.validationSchema: Implemented document validation schemas for all I/O operations (database, APIs, blob storage…) to ensure data integrity.

caseStudyDecisions.kubernetes: Moved execution from cloud functions to Kubernetes-based services to regain debuggability, operational control, and vendor independence.
caseStudyDecisions.orchestration: Architected the new isolated orchestration service using domain-driven design, deliberately separating pipeline concerns from product code to reduce blast radius and cognitive load.
caseStudyDecisions.reframing: Reframed the audio-to-notes pipeline as a mission-critical internal product rather than a collection of ad-hoc functions.
caseStudyDecisions.singleWriter: Centralized all database writes behind the pipeline, explicitly blocking direct ML access to prevent data corruption, race conditions, and side effects.
caseStudyDecisions.telemetryObservability: Required telemetry and observability mechanisms to ensure reliability at scale.
caseStudyDecisions.temporal: Selected Temporal as the workflow execution layer to enable deterministic, debuggable workflows with replay capability — trading short-term learning cost for long-term reliability and operability.
